summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of Amos Taylor, Jr. The documents primarily concern correspondence between Richard Helms, Director of Central Intelligence, and Sir Charles Spry of the Australian Security Intelligence Organization (ASIO) regarding the declassification of Warren Commission document CD-971 (and in one instance CD-071). Spry recommended against declassification, and Helms assured him that the CIA had no current plans to release the document. The documents do not provide any information about Amos Taylor, Jr.
significance: Since Amos Taylor, Jr. is not mentioned in the provided documents, their significance in the JFK assassination context cannot be determined.
